title: Party time at Tunnicliffe's Cotton Spinning Mill in 1914
description: The picture, which we dug out from the local archive collection, was taken more than a century ago, in 1914. Sticking with the party theme from recent weeks, this snap shows one from Tunnicliffe's Cotton Spinning Mill, in Leigh. Holden's Party at Tunnicliffe's Cotton Spinning Mill, Leigh, 1914.

title: King's Lynn's Harding's Pits may be used to grow fruit for community
description: A green space could be used to grow fruit for the community under plans to plant an orchard. Harding's Pits by the River Great Ouse, south of King's Lynn, was developed 20 years ago and is used for recreation and conservation. The borough council has recommended it is designated a village green and put in a bid for funding for an orchard.
